sentences.english: A pair of lovers in Shichahai, yes…
sentences.chinese: 昨日，在什剎海，一對情侶在雪景中纏綿。

sentences.english: She was very happy to wear his-and-hers clothing.
sentences.chinese: 她對於穿情侶裝表現得十分開心。

sentences.english: A pair of iridescent pink scallops embrace each other like lovers.
sentences.chinese: 一對泛著粉彩光澤的扇貝，像情侶般相互擁抱著。

sentences.english: Now in the campus, there many intimate lovers walking around.
sentences.chinese: 現在在校園裏，親暱的情侶隨處可見。

sentences.english: The two lovers dance cheek to cheek.
Do you accept couples sleep seperately?
sentences.chinese: 你會接受情侶分牀睡嗎？

sentences.english: Lisa:There are indeed some lovebirds in this office.
sentences.chinese: 辦公室裏真的有情侶喔。

sentences.english: The lovers roamed around the fields in complete forgetfulness of the time.
sentences.chinese: 情侶們漫步在田野間，完全忘了時間。

sentences.english: The couple honeymooned in Alfriston, in Sussex.
sentences.chinese: 這對兒情侶的蜜月去了蘇塞克斯郡的奧爾佛理斯頓。

sentences.english: The lovebirds now plan to get engaged this year.
sentences.chinese: 這對情侶計劃在今年訂婚。

sentences.english: Here are lovers in hand with the travel destination.
sentences.chinese: 這裏更是情侶們牽手同遊的勝地。

sentences.english: Significant changes in the river bank, there is no change is nothing more than the couple or less.
sentences.chinese: 江邊的變化很大，沒有變化的無非是情侶還是那麼多。

sentences.english: Meantime, the number of unmarried cohabiting couples has grown tenfold, the census shows.
sentences.chinese: 同時未婚同居的情侶增加了10倍。

sentences.english: In his testimony, Mr. Ko denied that he and Ms. Choi had been a couple.
sentences.chinese: 高永臺在證詞中否認他和崔順實曾是一對情侶。

sentences.english: The world puts off its mask of vastness of its lover.
sentences.chinese: 塵世對着它的情侶，揭下了它那浩淼的面具。

sentences.english: Such testers also had lower confidence in the quality and stability of their relationships.
sentences.chinese: 這些檢驗者在情侶關係的質量和穩定上也缺乏信心。

definition: (coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
